intro: Stemodiacra angulata, commonly known as the angular stemodia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic species. The plant is characterized by its distinctive angular stems and broad, arrow-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in spadices, typical of the Araceae family. It thrives in moist environments and is often found in wetlands or along the edges of water bodies.
